entities.name: goblet
entities.description: Goblets are mentioned as something that is being referred to, but not the main focus of the conversation. Harry says 'It's not about the goblets either' indicating that they are a distraction from what he is trying to say.

entities.name: mug
entities.description: Mundungus has gone cross-eyed trying to keep Harry's wand in view, implying that the wand is small and easily overlooked. This could be compared to a mug being small and easy to miss.

entities.name: mundungus
entities.description: Mundungus is mentioned as someone who has had his house cleaned out of valuable items. He is also described as going cross-eyed trying to keep Harry's wand in view.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character and is demanding some small portion of truth from someone. He is also using his wand to intimidate Mundungus.

relationships.description: Harry is intimidating Mundungus with his wand, as described in the text: 'Harry's wand was now so close to the bridge of Mundungus's nose that Mundungus had gone cross-eyed trying to keep it in view.'
Harry is demanding some small portion of truth from someone, as described in the text: 'It felt wonderful to have something to do, someone of whom he could demand some small portion of truth.'
